Japanese food has taken Barcelona by storm, and this place is, apparently, the  best for ramen in the city.  Indeed, the restaurant's reputation precedes it: Ramen Ya Hiro is small, and there is *always* a line to get in.  I spent a solid 30 minutes waiting for an outside table one recent chilly Spring evening.  The menu is simple, clear, and narrowly focused on that delicious, salty, meal-in-a-pot delight, ramen.  I had a soy ramen with strips of bamboo.  The broth was exceptionally flavorful, and the ramen noodles were delightfully cooked to perfection.  Indeed, this is quite authentic ramen.  My dinnermate chose a vegetarian ramen option not listed on the menu that, too, was quite flavorful, if a bit overseasoned.If I am ever in the mood for ramen in BCN, this is the place I will go.  Service was appropriate, friendly, and attentive, and the atmosphere is casual, if nothing particularly special.  Looking forward to another delicious meal at Ya Hiro!
